We need you here, Brother Haskell, to exert your influence against the presumption of men who feel that their brethren must ask permission of them, before engaging in the Lord's service where and in the manner that He indicates. Such presumption should (564) find no place in the cause of God. We hope that there may be such changes here that the work of the Lord may move on more smoothly. 


                                -319-
